webLinks.linkText: City of Sydney - Sydney Streets series on Crown Street

properties.publicTransport: Route 304 and 352 buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for City of Sydney's Sydney Streets event on Crown Street on Saturday 2 November. The event runs from 11am until 10pm.

  • Crown St will be closed in both directions between Cleveland St and Foveaux St from 8am until 11:30pm
  • Sections of Arthur St, Collins St, Davies St, Devonshire St, Jesson Ln, Jesson St, High Holborn St, Landsowne St, Miles St, Rainford St and Withers Ln will also be closed.
  • Motorists travelling from the south towards the city should detour via Cleveland St, Elizabeth St and Albion St.
  • Motorists travelling from the north should detour via Foveaux St, Elizabeth St and Cleveland St.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will be in effect from 7am until 11:30pm on sections of Crown St, Arthur St, Collins St, Davies St, Landsdowne St, Rainford St and Withers Ln.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

  • Collins St Between Crown St and Richards Ln eastbound

  • Arthur St between Crown St and Collins Ln
  • Collins St between Crown St and Richards Ln

arrangementElements.title: Road closures and special event clearways

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Karan Aujila at Qudos Bank Arena on Friday 25 October. Doors open 7pm and show runs from 8pm until 10:45pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the precinct as ticketholders travel in the already busy evening peak.

Attendees who need to drive are encouraged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NBL: Sydney Kings v NZ Breakers at Qudos Bank Arena. Tip-off from 2.15pm, full time around 4.30pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as fans travel to and from the game. Allow extra travel time on roads including the M4, Parramatta Road, Homebush Bay Drive and Concord Road.

Attendees who need to drive are encouraged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip by public transport.
properties.otherAdvice:
The RAAF Base Richmond Community Open at RAAF Base on Saturday 26 October. The event starts at 9am and finishes at 3pm.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching the site as attendees travel to the event.

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual on approach to RAAF Base Richmond especially along Richmond Road, Windsor Road, Hawkesbury Valley Way and The Northern Road.

If you have to drive, allow plenty of extra travel time as delays are expected. Travel with your group and aim to arrive early to avoid the delays and secure parking.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip on public transport.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Ghost In The Rocks Festival in Circular Quay from Thursday 31 October to Sunday 3 November. A variety of events will be taking place at First Fleet Park, Tallawoladah Lawn, George Street Alfresco Area, and in The Rocks including Jack Mundy, Playfair Street, Foundation Park and Atherden Street.

On Saturday 2 November from 5pm George St will be closed temporarily between Jack Mundy Place and Circular Quay West for a Halloween Parade.

Allow extra time in the area as roads may be busier than usual throughout the event as crowds make their way to and from the events.

properties.publicTransport: Route 437, 440 and 445 bus services will be diverting while road closures are in place. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the annual Italian Festa held along Norton Street from 10am to 5pm. 

Traffic will be heavy in the area and on approach to Leichhardt, including on Parramatta Rd and the City West Link. Motorists should allow extra travel time in the area and expect delays.

Norton St will be closed between Marion St and William St from 3am to 9pm. Other local roads around Norton St will also be closed.

Special event clearways will be in effect on sections of Norton Street and William St from 3am to 9pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.﻿

arrangementElements.title: Road Closures & Special Event Clearways

properties.publicTransport: Route 900 buses will be diverting while road closures are in place. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Parramatta Lanes is taking place in the Parramatta CBD from Wednesday 23 to Saturday 26 October. Being held at over 16 sites including gardens, rooftop carparks and lanes, the event starts daily at 5pm. The event will finish at 10pm on Wednesday and Thursday, and at 10.30pm on Friday and Saturday.

Road closures will be in place from Wedenesday 23 to Sunday 27 October on sections of Macquarie St, Phillip St and George St to safely facilitate the event. Parking restrictions will also be in place on George St and Macquarie St, so check signs carefully.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching the area and on detour routes as attendees travel to and from the event.

Allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.is

arrangementElements.html:
PARRAMATTA CBD

WEDNESDAY 23, THURSDAY 24, FRIDAY 25 & SATURDAY 26 OCTOBER

FROM 3PM TO MIDNIGHT

  • Macquarie Street between Marsden Street and Horwood Place (eastbound) 

FROM 6PM TO 10.30PM

  • Phillip Street between Marsden Street and Horwood Place (both directions) 

WEDNESDAY 23, THURSDAY 24, FRIDAY 25 OCTOBER - FROM 1PM TO 1AM

  • George Street between Marsden Street and Horwood Place (both directions) 

FROM 1PM SATURDAY 26 TO 5AM SUNDAY 27 OCTOBER

  • George Street between Marsden Street and Horwood Place (both directions)
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

roads.mainStreet: O'Connell Street, Phillip Street, Macquarie St and George Street

properties.otherAdvice: The Lithgow Halloween Festival will be held on Saturday 26 October from 4pm to 10pm. The event takes place in the vicinity of the main CBD and there will be an increase in traffic volumes on both local and state networks. A small quantity of temporary traffic management signage will be installed on Chifley Road advising motorists of changed traffic conditions.

The Boorowa Touch and Netball Carnival is on Friday 25 October with changed traffic conditions in place from 8.30am to 4.30pm.

The carnival is expecting 7000 spectators and over 4,500 competitors from schools around Canberra and the State.

Alternating (stop/slow) traffic conditions will be in place on Jugiong Street to allow motorists to pass in one direction at a time.

A speed reduction of 40km/h will be in place on Lachlan Valley Way, Murringo Rd, Cunningar Rd, Bally Ryan Rd and Gereldine Rd.

properties.publicTransport: Event tickets include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Everest Carnival: Stakes Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race at 12:30pm, last race at 6:10pm, concert from 6:20pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to and from the races.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Special event clearways will be in place at the following times and locations: 

  • 4am – 7pm: Darley Road between Alison Road and Centennial Park round-a-bout (western side) 
  • 8am – 7pm: Ascot Street between Doncaster Avenue and Randwick Racecourse Ascot Street entry (both sides) 
  • 3pm – 7pm: High Street between UNSW Gate 2 and Anzac Parade (southern side) 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.otherAdvice:
Banna Avenue will be closed between Crossing Street and Jondaryan Avenue for the Griffith Citrus Sculptures at the following times:

  • Set up - Sun 13 Oct 6am-2:30pm
  • Event launch - Fri 18 Oct 4:30pm-10:30pm
  • Pack up - Sun 27 Oct 6am-2:30pm

Detours will be in place for light and heavy vehicles.
properties.diversions:
Heavy vehicle detour via Bridge St and Crossing St during the exhibition.

Light vehicles will be detoured via Yambil St during the event launch.

All vehicles will be detoured via Bridge St and Crossing St during the installation and pack up of the event.

properties.publicTransport: Buses will run frequently between the city, Bondi Junction and Bondi Beach. Buses will be in high demand so allow extra travel time. Avoid the largest crowds by visiting on a weekday instead. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sculpture by the Sea exhibition returns to the Bondi to Tamarama coastal walk for 18 days from Friday 18 October to Monday 4 November. Changed traffic conditions and parking restrictions will be in place.

With up to 500,000 people expected to visit throughout the exhibition, significant delays are expected on roads approaching Bondi and Tamarama beaches including Bondi Rd, Old South Head Rd and Syd Einfeld Dr. 

Motorists should avoid driving through the area where possible or expect delays and allow plenty of extra travel time, particularly on weekends.

Road closures and changed traffic conditions:

  • Local roads will close from 7:30am to 6:30pm daily in Bronte, Bondi and Tamarama including sections of Ashley St, Bayview St, Birell St, Carlisle St, Darling St, Fletcher St. Illawong Ave, Kenneth St, Marks Ln, Notts Ave, Rowland Ave, Silvia St, Turner St, Wilga St and Wolaroi Cres.
  • One-way traffic conditions will be in place around the coastal walk for the duration of the event from 9am Friday 18 October until 10am Monday 4 November. Allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic controllers and exercise caution.

Special event clearways: Strict parking restrictions will be in effect each weekend of the event on Saturday 19 and Sunday 20 October, Saturday 26 and Sunday 27 October and Saturday 2 and Sunday 3 November at the following times and locations:

  • 7am to 2pm: Bondi Rd between Old South Head and opposite Sandridge St at Bondi Beach (northern side)
  • 12pm midday to 7pm: Bondi Rd between Sandridge St at Bondi Beach and Oxford St at Bondi Junction (southern side)
  • 8am to 4pm: Campbell Pde between Queen Elizabeth Drive and Beach Rd at Bondi Beach (Eastern side)

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed it will be relocated to the nearest legal parking space, use the Find My Car website or call 132 701 to find its new location.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

BRONTE, TAMARAMA & BONDI

7:30AM TO 6:30PM DAILY FROM FRIDAY 18 OCTOBER TO MONDAY 4 NOVEMBER 2024

Access will be maintained for residents and taxis only

  • Ashley St between Turner St and end of lane
  • Bayview St between West of Bronte Marine Drive and end of street
  • Birrell St between Tamarama St and Cross St (Eastbound lanes only)
  • Carlisle St between Dellview St and end of street
  • Cross St between Birrell St and Turner St (Southbound lanes only)
  • Darling St between Alfred St and Ashely St
  • Fletcher St between Sandridge St and Marks Ln
  • Illawong Ave from Farrelly's Ave
  • Kenneth St between Alexander St and Marks Ln
  • Marks Ln between Kenneth St and Fletcher St

  • Rowland Ave between Fletcher St and Wilga St
  • Silvia St between Fletcher St and end of street
  • Turner St between Cross St and Ashley St (Eastbound lanes only)
  • Wilga St between Sandridge St and end of street
  • Wolaroi Cres between Thompson St and end of street

ONE WAY CHANGED TRAFFIC CONDITIONS

The following roads will become one-way only roads for the duration of the event:

From 9am, Fri 18 Oct until 10am, Mon 4 Nov:

  • Mirimar Ave northbound only from Hewlett St to Thompson St
  • Thompson St westbound only from Mirimar Ave to Ashley St
  • Ashley St northbound only from Darling St to Turner St
  • Turner St westbound only from Ashley St to Cross St
  • Cross St northbound only from Turner St to Birrell St
  • Birrell St westbound only from Cross St to Tamarama St
  • Marks Ln southbound only from Fletcher St to Kenneth St 

From 10am, Fri 18 Oct until 10am, Mon 4 Nov:

  • Gaerloch Ave southbound only from Alexander St to Dellview
  • Dellview St northbound only from Pacific Ave to Fletcher St
arrangementElements.title: Road closures & Changed traffic conditions

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Amy Shark at ICC Sydney Theatre. Concert starts at 7:15pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as attendees travel to the event in the busy evening peak.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on trains, metro and light rail. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Women's Big Bash League at North Sydney Oval. Sydney Sixers v Adelaide Strikers starts from 6:10pm, finish around 9pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around North Sydney Oval, allow extra time and travel with a group if you have to drive. Limited street parking will be available in the area Ridge St and Ward St are within walking distance of the Oval.

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on trains, metro and light rail. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Women's Big Bash League at North Sydney Oval. Sydney Thunder v Hobart Hurricanes starts at 7:15pm, finish around 10:15pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around North Sydney Oval, allow extra time and travel with a group if you have to drive. Limited street parking will be available in the area Ridge St and Ward St are within Walking Distance of the Oval.

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on trains, metro and light rail. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Women's Big Bash League Double Header at North Sydney Oval. Sydney Thunder v Adelaide Strikers start at 3.45pm. Sydney Sixers v Melbourne Stars start from 7.15pm. Event end approx 10.15pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around North Sydney Oval, allow extra time and travel with a group if you have to drive. Limited street parking will be available in the area Ridge St and Ward St are within Walking Distance of the Oval.

The Australian National Field Days will be held at the Borenore site (15kms west of Orange NSW) from Thursday 24 Oct to Saturday 26 Oct. More then 600 exhibitors travel to display their products and services during the 3 day event. A speed limit reduction of 60 km/h will be implemented on the Escort Way due to the increased traffic activity attending the event

properties.publicTransport: Tickets include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Everest Carnival: Golden Eagle Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race at 12.10pm, last race from 6.00pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

A Special Event Clearway will be in place from 7am to 8pm on Grand Avenue from 100m Prior to Gate 1 Australian Turf Club Rosehill Gardens to opposite Grand Avenue North. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways will be in place at the following times and location: 

  • 7am to 8pm: Grand Avenue from 100m Prior to Gate 1 Australian Turf Club Rosehill Gardens to opposite Grand Avenue North

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on transport. Buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Western Sydney Wanderers v Adelaide United at CommBank Stadium. Kick-off at 7:35pm, full time around 9:30pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching and within Parramatta as fans travel to the game. Allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

Roads outside the stadium will close from 9.30pm until 10pm to allow crowds to safely leave the venue. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Be patient leaving car parks as traffic will be heavy and follow the directions of traffic controllers and Police.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Ridin Hearts Festival at Sydney Showground from 2pm to around 11pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as attendees travel to and from the event. Travel with your group and allow extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Dr and Concord Rd.

If you have to drive, carpool with your group pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.  

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close some local roads to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, see the Sydney Olympic Park interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Double Header: Central Coast Mariners at Industree Group Stadium. ALW Central Coast Mariners v Sydney FC kick off at 2:15pm, ALM Central Coast Mariners v Perth Glory kick off at 5pm and full-time approx. 6:50pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including on the Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the match.

Dane Drive will close from 1.15pm between the Central Coast Highway and Donnison Street for the safety of pedestrians, and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

Film Premiere at the State Theatre on Sunday 3 November.

Road and lane closures will be in place for the event:

  • From 12:01am Sunday 3 November to 1am Monday 4 November: Market St lanes 1, 2 and 4 will be closed between Pitt St and George St.
  • From 10am to 7pm on Sunday 3 November: Market St will be closed between Castlereagh St and George St, and Pitt St between Park St and Market St.

Footpath closures will also be in place from 12:01am Sunday 3 November to 1am Monday 4 November on the southern footpath on Market St between Pitt St and George St, and from 10am to 7pm on Sunday 3 November on Market St Pedestrian crossings at Pitt St.

Motorist should expect traffic delays along Market St during the event, allow extra travel time in the area and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads around the theatre.

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on transport. Buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Joga Bonito Tour at CommBank Stadium. Kick-off at 7:30pm, full time around 9:20pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching and within Parramatta as fans travel to the game. Allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

Roads outside the stadium will close from 9.30pm until 10pm to allow crowds to safely leave the venue. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Roads around the stadium will close as crowds make their way to the game. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area.

Be patient leaving car parks as traffic will be heavy and follow the directions of traffic controllers and Police.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in concert tickets, additional light rail services will run frequently before and after the show. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

properties.otherAdvice:
Stray Kids World Tour at Allianz Stadium. Concert starts from 7.30pm, and finishes around 10.30pm.

With large crowds expected, traffic delays are expected on roads approaching Moore Park.

Motorists should expect delays and allow extra travel time on the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd. Attendees are urged to catch public transport.

Changed traffic conditions

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 12pm and will reopen once crowds have safely left the area.
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave however access to EP3 grass car park, EP2 car park and drop off areas will be maintained from Moore Park Rd and Lang Rd. Please note EP2 parking is very limited due to upgrade works.
  • A pick up and drop off zone will be located on the northern side of Moore Park Rd at Oatley Rd opposite the stadium.
  • The Moore Park Rd/Fitzroy St cycleway will be closed from Poate Rd to Bourke St from 10pm to 11.30pm.

Special event clearways will be in place on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas on Saturday 26 October from 3pm to midnight on sections of Albion Street, Fitzroy Street, Moore Park Road and Lang Road, and from 6am to midnight on sections of Cleveland Street.  

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK

From 6am to midnight 

  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (southern side) 
  • Cleveland Street between Abercrombie Street and South Dowling Street (northern side) 

From 3pm to midnight  

  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (both sides) 
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side) 
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side) 
  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Poate Road (southern side) 
  • Moore Park Road from approx. 80m west of Oatley Road to approx. 75m east of Oatley Road (northern side) 
  • Lang Rd between Anzac Pde and Cook Road (northern side)
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.otherAdvice:
The Harbour2Vine Cycle Classic is a 4-5 hour staged bicycle event over a 91km length. The ride departs from Rydges Hotel in Newcastle at 7:30am, ending at the Rydges Hunter Valley in Lovedale around 12pm.

Roads impacted included - Wharf Road, Workshop Way, Honeysuckle Drive, Hannell Street, Industrial Drive, Maitland Road, New England Highway, John Renshaw Drive, Tarro Street, Victoria Street, Northcoate Street, Cessnock Road, Allandale Road and Wine Country Drive.

Motorists should exercise caution and allow extra time.

properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the North Sydney Festival from 11am to 5pm on Saturday.

Local roads in North Sydney CBD will close from 5am to 9pm including:

  • Denison St between Victoria Cross Metro Station and Mount St. Managed local access permitted to the northern end of Denison St from Berry St.
  • Mount St between Denison St and Walker St.
  • Spring St between Denison St and Walker St. Managed local access maintained.

Street parking will be also be restricted within the event footprint from 3pm Friday 1 November until 9pm Saturday 2 November.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Route 389 and 311 buses will be diverting around road closures. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney's Sydney Streets event on Harris St. The event runs from 11am until 10pm. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic controllers and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

Road closures will be in place from 8am until 11:30pm on:

  • Harris St between Pyrmont Bridge Rd and John St
  • Miller St between Little Mount St and Harris St

Special event clearways will be in effect from 7am until 11:30pm on sections of Harris St and Miller St. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.title: Road closures & Special event clearways

properties.otherAdvice: The Jacaranda Parade of Youth will be held on Saturday 26 October between 8:30am to 9:30am. Rolling road closures will be in place along Prince Street (from Kemp Street up to Bacon Street).
properties.diversions: Follow signage and the direction of traffic controllers for local detours.
properties.displayName: SPECIAL EVENT Jacaranda Parade of Youth

properties.otherAdvice: The Lake Mac Emergency and Essential Services Expo will be held on Saturday 26 October 2024 at Speers Point Park from 9am to 1pm.
properties.displayName: Lake Mac Emergency and Essential Services Expo

properties.otherAdvice:
Carnival Capers is back as part of the Jacaranda festival and will be held on Wednesday 30 October between 1pm and 10 pm.

Local detours will be in place.

The Sapphire City Festival Fireworks will be held on Inverell Bridge on Saturday 28 October from 8pm to 10pm. The following traffic changes will be in place for the event:

  • The Gwydir Highway (Warialda Road) will be closed to all traffic between Brae St and Campbell St between 8pm and 10pm while the festival fireworks display is in progress. The Town Bridge will be closed to pedestrians during this time.
properties.diversions:
For the Gwydir Hwy closure, motorists will be detoured via Bundarra Rd, Medora St, Cameron St, Macintyre St and Old Bundara Rd to rejoin the Gwydir Highway.

Motorists travelling in the area should allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
(G)I-DLE at Qudos Bank Arena. Doors open 6pm and show runs from 7:30pm until 10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the precinct as ticketholders travel to and from the event.

Attendees who need to drive are encouraged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
WNBL + NBL: Double Header at Qudos Bank Arena. WNBL Flames v Capitals start at 2pm, NBL Kings v Jack Jumpers start at 4:15pm, event end around 6:30pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as fans travel to and from the game. Allow extra travel time on roads including the M4, Parramatta Road, Homebush Bay Drive and Concord Road.

Attendees who need to drive are encouraged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
The Harden Picnic Races will take place on Saturday 26 October.

A large attendance is expected. A speed reduction will be in place on Burley Griffin Way.

There will be a number of rolling road closures on Prince Street as part of the Jacaranda festival.

  • Thursday 31 October – Jacaranda Thursday 6am to 3pm - Prince Street (from Fitzroy St, across Queen)
  • Saturday 2 November – Vintage Car Show, 7am to 2pm - Duke Street (between Fitzroy Street and Victoria Street) Jacaranda Criterium, 12pm to 3pm, Prince Street (Bacon Street to Dobie Street) Jacaranda Float Procession, 3pm to 7pm, Prince Street (Victoria Street to Arthur Street)

Follow detour signage in place.

The Thunderbolts festival will be held on Saturday 26 October between 10am and 4pm in Alma Park, Queen St, Uralla. The Fleet Warbirds Parade will take place from 10:30am to 11:30am. During this time, the New England Highway will be closed between Park Street and Hill Street.

The detour is NOT suitable for Restricted Access Heavy vehicles. Restricted Access Heavy Vehicles will be parked-up during the closure.
properties.diversions:
Light vehicles will be detoured via John Street, Maitland Street and King Street. 

If travelling from the north on Thunderbolts Way, Restricted Access Heavy vehicles will be stopped at Rocky River Road for the one hour road closure between 10:30-11:30am.

Heavy vehicles will be parked on Bridge Street between John and Park Streets for northbound vehicles and between King and Hill Streets for southbound vehicles.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney Zombie Walk will be taking place on Saturday 2 November at St Marys Cathedral. Event starts at 12pm and the walk starts at 2pm.

Road closures will be in place to accomodate the event from 12pm to 5pm on Prince Albert Rd, and College St between Prince Albert Rd and William St. Motorists can detour around the closure via Park St, Riley St and St Marys Rd.

Motorists travelling in the area should allow extra time and watch out for pedestrians.

properties.publicTransport: Extra trains will run for event participants. Visit transportnsw.info for more details.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 10,000 cyclists will ride from Sydney to Wollongong for the annual MS Gong Ride. The 82 km ride from Tempe Recreation Reserve starts from 6am and the 54km ride will start at Preston Park, Engadine from 8am. Both events finish at Lang Park, Wollongong by 4:30pm.

Road and lane closures will be in place along sections of the course.

  • 4am to 9:30am from Tempe to Sutherland: sections of West Botany St, Holbeach Ave and Bestic St. The speed limit will be reduced to 60/km along Rocky Point Rd/Taren Point Rd from Sans Souci to Taren Point.
  • 5am to 10am from Sutherland to Waterfall: Lane closures on the Princes Hwy from Kirrawee to Loftus and the speed limit will be reduced to 60km/h from Kirrawee to Waterfall. Delays are expected travelling southbound on the Princes Hwy during this time. 
  • 5am to 2:30pm in the Royal National Park: McKell Ave, Lady Wakehurst Dr, Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Otford Rd. Access to the Royal National Park is via Farnell Ave only. The speed limit will be reduced to 40km/h along Lawrence Hargrave Dr from Stanwell Park to Thirroul from 6am to 3pm.
  • 5am to 4.30pm in Wollongong: sections of Bourke St, Cliff Rd and George Hanley Dr will be closed. Sections of Hector St, Marine Dr and Hinton St around the finish area at Lang Park will remain closed until 7pm. The speed limit will be reduced to 40km/h along Squires Way and George Hanley Dr between Fairy Meadow and Wollongong from 7am to 2pm

Motorists should exercise caution as cyclists will be sharing some roads along the course. Motorists are reminded when overtaking cyclists to leave a 1.5m distance on roads with speed limits over 60km/h and a 1m distance on roads 60km/h or under.

Special event clearways will be in place along key sections of the course between 4am and 4:30pm. Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed it will be relocated to the nearest legal parking space, use the Find My Car website or call 132 701 to find its new location.﻿

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Oktoberfest in the Gardens at the Phillip Precinct in The Domain from 1pm to 9pm. Thousands of revellers are expected at Australia’s biggest Oktoberfest celebration.

Traffic will be heavier than usual in the Sydney CBD on approaches to The Domain before and after the event.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time and watch out for pedestrians in the area.

Changed traffic conditions including road closures will be in place within and around The Domain for crowd safety before, during and after the event. Follow directions of signage and traffic controllers on site.

A dedicated drop off zone will be located on Hospital Rd at Art Gallery Rd.

Road closures

From 7pm to 10pm

  • Art Gallery Rd will be closed at Hospital Rd

From 8pm to 10pm at the direction of NSW Police

  • College St from Park St to Prince Albert Rd
  • Cathedral St at St Marys Rd
  • Hospital Rd from Art Gallery Rd to Shakespeare Pl
  • Macquarie St from Hunter St to Prince Albert Rd
  • Prince Albert Rd from Macquarie St to Art Gallery Rd
  • St Mary’s Rd from Prince Albert Rd to Sir John Young Cr
  • St James Rd from Elizabeth St to Macquarie St

roads.mainStreet: Macquarie St, Prince Albert Rd, College St, Art Gallery Rd

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NBL: Illawarra Hawks v Melbourne United at WIN Entertainment Centre. Tip-off at 7:30pm, full time around 9:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual as fans travel to and from the match. Allow extra travel time on roads including Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St.

Fans driving to the game on the freeway are encouraged to use the Masters Rd exit to avoid congestion at Mount Ousley Rd, both in and out of Wollongong.

Motorists are advised to allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

The Rhododendron Festival has been held annually since 1953. Whilst the festival includes various events, Rhodo Day Saturday 2 November will see a Grand Parade through the town along Wentworth St. Wentworth St will be closed from Hat Hill Rd to Prince George St and Leichardt St closed from the Great Western Hwy to Wentworth St from 10am to 12pm. Traffic control will be in place.
properties.diversions: Detours can be made via Prince George St or Hat Hill Road.

properties.otherAdvice: Alternating (stop/slow) traffic conditions will be in place and a speed reduction on Kings Hwy, at the entrance to the Rodeo.

An open day at TfNSW Future Mobility Testing and Research Centre will be held on Thursday 31 Oct 2025 from 10am to 4pm. A speed reduction of 40km/h will be in place along with a portable traffic signal at the entrance to the Centre for the event.
properties.displayName: TfNSW Future Mobility Testiing & Research Centre Community Open Day

properties.otherAdvice:
Triathlon Huskisson will take place on 3 and 4 November with a number of events occurring over the weekend.

Local road closures will be in place on Bowen St, Nowra St, Fegan St, Hawke St, Owen St, Tomerong St, Morton St, Fairfax Rd, Sydney St, Currambene St & Woollamia Rd.

Access to Huskison and Vincentia will be via Jervis Bay Rd.

properties.publicTransport: Concert tickets include travel on public transport. Express trains and Major Event Buses will run. Route 525 and 526 services will be diverting while roads are closed in the precinct. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Coldplay – Music of the Spheres World Tour at Accor Stadium in Sydney Olympic Park on Wednesday 6, Thursday 7, Saturday 9 & Sunday 10 November. Support act from 6pm, Coldplay on stage from 8.30pm and finish around 11pm each concert night.

With over 300,000 fans epected over four concert nights, significant traffic delays are expected on roads approaching the precinct and entering car parks.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

  • CAR PARKS: parking in the precinct is in high demand and expected to sell out before the event. Ticketholders who have to drive must pre-book parking ahead of time to secure a space.
  • If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.
  • Alternatively, consider parking at a nearby train station commuter car park and continuing your trip by train to Olympic Park, at no extra cost.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events and accommodate additional transport services. For road closure details, view the interactive map.
